items.description:
Hey everyone,

Happy Friday!

Another week of great links so thanks to everyone who contributed!

I hope you, your friends and your family are all staying safe and well! We are still on lockdown here in the UK, it‚Äôs strange but slowly getting used to it.

Have a wonderful weekend :)

Luce üß°

items.title: ‚ÄúLimited time offer: a free support hour for your Xamarin project!
items.description: Are you running into problems with your project, or could you use some advice? At Xablu, we offer case-by-case support from topnotch developers. You can create a ticket for your issue, our developers will create tailored solutions and they will guide you through their work. No subscription or underlying costs: only pay for the support you need! Book your free hour of support now!‚Äù

items.title: Supercharging your mobile analytics with App Center and Application Insights
items.description:
Application Insights can be a really powerful tool for extracting meaningul information from any mobile application. This great post from John shows how you can get started and begin to take advantage of these insights.

Supercharging your mobile analytics with App Center and Application Insights by John Thiriet
items.description_markdown:
Application Insights can be a really powerful tool for extracting meaningul information from any mobile application. This great post from John shows how you can get started and begin to take advantage of these insights.

[**Supercharging your mobile analytics with App Center and Application Insights**](https://johnthiriet.com/mobile-analytics-with-app-center-and-application-insights/) by [John Thiriet](https://twitter.com/johnthiriet)

embedded_links.title: **Supercharging your mobile analytics with App Center and Application Insights**

items.title: Bluetooth Printing in Xamarin Forms using Shiny
items.description:
When developing enterprise salesforce applications is very common to support printing orders, collections, receipts using a portable bluetooth thermal printer. If you search around there‚Äôs not a lot of content on how to achieve this in a cross-platform way, fortunately now we have an awesome set of libraries called Shiny(designed to help make device services & backgrounding easy on Xamarin & UWP platforms). In this article, Rendy shows you how to do bluetooth printing with a thermal printer by using Shiny.Bluetooth library

Bluetooth Printing in Xamarin Forms using Shiny by Rendy Del Rosario
items.description_markdown:
When developing enterprise salesforce applications is very common to support printing orders, collections, receipts using a portable bluetooth thermal printer. If you search around there‚Äôs not a lot of content on how to achieve this in a cross-platform way, fortunately now we have an awesome set of libraries called Shiny(designed to help make device services & backgrounding easy on Xamarin & UWP platforms).
In this article, Rendy shows you how to do bluetooth printing with a thermal printer by using Shiny.Bluetooth library

[**Bluetooth Printing in Xamarin Forms using Shiny**](https://www.xamboy.com/2020/04/20/bluetooth-printing-in-xamarin-forms-using-shiny/https://www.xamboy.com/2020/04/20/bluetooth-printing-in-xamarin-forms-using-shiny/) by [Rendy Del Rosario](https://twitter.com/rdelrosario)

embedded_links.title: **Bluetooth Printing in Xamarin Forms using Shiny**

items.title: Creating a login flow with Xamarin Forms Shell
items.description:
Login is a very common practice in mobile apps, but the conditions on which it appears and where it sits in the navigation stack is very important. Xamarin.Forms 4.0 introduced Shell, and since 4.5 now supports modal navigation. Mark has written a follow up to a previous post on log in, this time showing how you can do it using Shell!

Creating a login flow with Xamarin Forms Shell by Mark Allibone
items.description_markdown:
Login is a very common practice in mobile apps, but the conditions on which it appears and where it sits in the navigation stack is very important. Xamarin.Forms 4.0 introduced Shell, and since 4.5 now supports modal navigation. Mark has written a follow up to a previous post on log in, this time showing how you can do it using Shell!

[**Creating a login flow with Xamarin Forms Shell**](https://mallibone.com/post/xamarin-forms-shell-login) by [Mark Allibone](https://twitter.com/mallibone)

embedded_links.title: **Creating a login flow with Xamarin Forms Shell**

items.title: Using Refit to consume Restful Web Service in Xamarin Forms
items.description:
When developing an application, it‚Äôs very likely that much of its development will require interaction with a web service. We can use different tools to connect and retrieve data from web services but in this post, Leomaris shows you how to do it using Refit!

Using Refit to consume Restful Web Service in Xamarin Forms by Leomaris Reyes
items.description_markdown:
When developing an application, it‚Äôs very likely that much of its development will require interaction with a web service. We can use different tools to connect and retrieve data from web services but in this post, Leomaris shows you how to do it using Refit!

[**Using Refit to consume Restful Web Service in Xamarin Forms**](https://askxammy.com/using-refit-to-consume-restful-web-service-in-xamarin-forms/) by [Leomaris Reyes](https://twitter.com/LeomarisReyes11)

embedded_links.title: **Using Refit to consume Restful Web Service in Xamarin Forms**

items.title: Get Permissions, App Theme, & Authentication
items.description:
Xamarin.Essentials recently released 1.5 with some great new features including permissions, app themes, authentication and more!

Get Permissions, App Theme, & Authentication by James Montemagno
items.description_markdown:
Xamarin.Essentials recently released 1.5 with some great new features including permissions, app themes, authentication and more!

items.title: Join the Xamarin + Cognitive Services Crazy Combo Challenge!
items.description:
The ‚Äúchallenge‚Äù concept has been around for a few years now at Microsoft. Basically what happens is Microsoft provides you with a pre-built solution in the form of some sample application. From there it is up to you to let your mind go free and implement more awesome things. This challenge was written by Gerald Versluis and it should be so much fun to get invovled!

Join the Xamarin + Cognitive Services Crazy Combo Challenge! by Gerald Versluis
items.description_markdown:
The ‚Äúchallenge‚Äù concept has been around for a few years now at Microsoft. Basically what happens is Microsoft provides you with a pre-built solution in the form of some sample application. From there it is up to you to let your mind go free and implement more awesome things. This challenge was written by Gerald Versluis and it should be so much fun to get invovled!

[**Join the Xamarin + Cognitive Services Crazy Combo Challenge!**](https://blog.verslu.is/xamarin/xamarin-forms-xamarin/join-the-xamarin-cognitive-services-crazy-combo-challenge/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=join-the-xamarin-cognitive-services-crazy-combo-challenge) by [Gerald Versluis](https://twitter.com/jfversluis)

embedded_links.title: **Join the Xamarin + Cognitive Services Crazy Combo Challenge!**

items.title: Playing with animation in Xamarin.Forms
items.description:
Movement breathes life into your app. But getting started with animation in Xamarin.Forms might not be the simplest thing. This post explains how to get started with creating some cool animations you can use to spice up your app.

Playing with animation in Xamarin.Forms by Steven Thewissen
items.description_markdown:
Movement breathes life into your app. But getting started with animation in Xamarin.Forms might not be the simplest thing. This post explains how to get started with creating some cool animations you can use to spice up your app.

[**Playing with animation in Xamarin.Forms**](https://www.thewissen.io/playing-with-animation-in-xamarin-forms/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=playing-with-animation-in-xamarin-forms) by [Steven Thewissen](https://twitter.com/devnl)

items.title: Migrating ListView to CollectionView in Xamarin.Forms
items.description:
In Part Two of this series on the MFractor blog, learn how to migrate your ListView cells so you can use them in a CollectionView.

Migrating ListView to CollectionView in Xamarin.Forms by Matthew Robbins
items.description_markdown:
In Part Two of this series on the MFractor blog, learn how to migrate your ListView cells so you can use them in a CollectionView.

[**Migrating ListView to CollectionView in Xamarin.Forms**](https://www.mfractor.com/blogs/news/migrating-listview-to-collectionview-in-xamarin-forms-user-interface) by [Matthew Robbins](https://twitter.com/matthewrdev)

items.title: Azure Resource Organization Cheat Sheet
items.description:
Have you ever wondered how Azure resources are organised and paid for? Got confused by the terminology or how best to group things? Frank had this issue and put together an awesome cheat sheat!

Azure Resource Organization Cheat Sheet by Frank Krueger
items.description_markdown:
Have you ever wondered how Azure resources are organised and paid for? Got confused by the terminology or how best to group things? Frank had this issue and put together an awesome cheat sheat!

items.title: Source Link - Debug Third-Party Libraries | The Xamarin Show
items.description:
This week, James is joined by friend of the show Gerald Versluis, Xamarin.Forms Engineer, who shows off one of the coolest feature ever for app developers and library creators, Source Link. When a library is Source Link enabled you can debug INTO the source code when you are running debugging your app. This helps you diagnose issues faster than ever, check it out.

Source Link - Debug Third-Party Libraries by James Montemagno
items.description_markdown:
This week, James is joined by friend of the show Gerald Versluis, Xamarin.Forms Engineer, who shows off one of the coolest feature ever for app developers and library creators, Source Link. When a library is Source Link enabled you can debug INTO the source code when you are running debugging your app. This helps you diagnose issues faster than ever, check it out.

[**Source Link - Debug Third-Party Libraries**](https://channel9.msdn.com/Shows/XamarinShow/Source-Link-Debug-Third-Party-Libraries--The-Xamarin-Show) by [James Montemagno](https://channel9.msdn.com/Niners/JamesMontemagno)

items.title: Xamarin Podcast: Logically Embed That Authentication
items.description:
The Xamarin Podcast is back for April. In this episode, James and Matt discuss all things authentication and look back on the great Focus on Xamarin event that happened at the end of March.

Xamarin Podcast: Logically Embed That Authentication by Matt Soucoup
items.description_markdown:

items.title: Merge Conflict: 198: Why Can't We Be Friends
items.description:
Have you ever thought of creating your own social network? How about just having a friend system in your app? How would you implement it? How would you handle authentication? How would it all work? We discuss as James tries to implement it in his latest app.

Merge Conflict: 198: Why Can't We Be Friends by Merge Conflict
items.description_markdown:
Have you ever thought of creating your own social network? How about just having a friend system in your app? How would you implement it? How would you handle authentication? How would it all work? We discuss as James tries to implement it in his latest app.

[**Merge Conflict: 198: Why Can't We Be Friends**](https://www.mergeconflict.fm/198) by [Merge Conflict](https://www.mergeconflict.fm)

embedded_links.title: **Merge Conflict: 198: Why Can't We Be Friends**

items.title: Xamarin.Forms 101: Controls for boolean, numeric, and date and time input | The Xamarin Show
items.description:
Join Maddy Leger for another great Xamarin.Forms 101. In this episode, learn about the different controls you can use to get boolean, incremental, date, and other types of values from your users.

Xamarin.Forms 101: Controls for boolean, numeric, and date and time input by Maddy Leger
items.description_markdown:
Join Maddy Leger for another great Xamarin.Forms 101. In this episode, learn about the different controls you can use to get boolean, incremental, date, and other types of values from your users.

[**Xamarin.Forms 101: Controls for boolean, numeric, and date and time input**](https://channel9.msdn.com/Shows/XamarinShow/XamarinForms-101-Controls-for-boolean-numeric-and-date-and-time-input) by [Maddy Leger](https://channel9.msdn.com/Niners/maddyleger1)

embedded_links.title: **Xamarin.Forms 101: Controls for boolean, numeric, and date and time input**

items.title: Introducing TinyMvvm 2.0
items.description:
A new version of TinyMvvm is now available which comes with support for URL navigation in Xamarin.Forms Shell and other cool features.

Introducing TinyMvvm 2.0 by Daniel Hindrikes
items.description_markdown:
